examples.sentence: The fencer jabbed precisely at his opponent's shoulder.
She jabbed her umbrella into the snow to test the depth.
The boxer kept jabbing at his opponent's ribs.
He suddenly jabbed his elbow backward into the attacker's stomach.
The nurse gave me a quick jab in the arm for vaccination.
A wasp's jab can be very painful.
His final jab knocked out the challenger.
The comedian's verbal jab at the politician went viral.
The cat kept jabbing at the moving laser dot.
I need to take a flu jab before winter comes.

examples.sentence: The auctioneer jabbered so fast that I missed the final price.
He kept jabbering about Bitcoin while chewing spicy crayfish.
Sparrows jabbered in the morning like stockbrokers at opening bell.
The squirrel jabbered angrily when I approached its walnut stash.
The toddler's jabber sounded like an alien language to his parents.
Amid the jabber of the mahjong table, I heard my winning tile being discarded.
The tour guide jabbered away about terracotta warriors' hairstyles.
He jabbered out an excuse about subway delays while panting heavily.
My phone charger doesn't fit this British-style jack.
The guitarist angrily kicked the broken audio jack.
Using a jack improperly may turn your BMW into scrap metal.
The panda-shaped jack in the repair shop looks dangerously cute.
Every jack in the office got a tie on Valentine's Day.
Hey jack, stop flexing your new sneakers!
They jacked up the car to rescue the stuck cat.
My mom jacked me about the blind date 10 times today.
Streaming platforms jacked up subscription fees again.
The jack rabbit was showing off its ears to females.
Our product manager is a jack of all trades but master of Douyin.
She hit the jackpot by marrying a man who loves doing dishes.

examples.sentence: A golden jackal was spotted near the Great Wall, causing tourists to panic.
Jackals often follow lions to scavenge leftovers, just like some influencers chase trending topics.
The corrupt official's jackals took bribes in WeChat red packets.
Those keyboard warriors are nothing but internet jackals.
He became a jackal for foreign powers, selling state secrets for crypto coins.
The celebrity's jackals attacked critics on social media.
He jackals for the mafia, delivering threatening Douyin videos.
Stop jackaling for those scam call centers!
The assistant played the jackal to frame his boss's rival.
The museum displayed a Prussian officer's jackboot with 50cm shafts.
His jackboots left deep prints in the snow during winter training.
A jackdaw stole my grandmother's silver thimble to decorate its nest.
Jackdaws in London's parks have learned to open chip packets with their beaks.
The pickpocket was as clever as a jackdaw, snatching phones without being noticed.
His neon pink jacket made him look like a walking traffic cone.
The delivery rider's jacket has 10 pockets for takeout orders.
The dumbbell's rubber jacket prevents floor scratches.
All charging cables come with anti-bite jackets for pets.
The stylist jacketed the panda mascot in a qipao design.
They jacketed the pipeline with thermal insulation layers.
The book jacket summary made me buy this useless self-help book.
Tourists must wear life jackets when bamboo rafting.

examples.sentence: The gambler lost his house betting on the jackpot.
In Macau casinos, the jackpot tables require special chips.
The Powerball jackpot reached $1.9 billion last week.
Winning the jackpot is statistically less likely than being struck by lightning.
Their viral TikTok video was a career jackpot.
The startup hit the jackpot with their AI pet camera.
Finding this vintage watch at a flea market was a real jackpot.
The archaeologists hit the jackpot when uncovering the terracotta warriors.
He's in the jackpot after his embezzlement was exposed.
Missing the deadline put our project in the jackpot.
Bilibili hit the jackpot with their anime licensing strategy.
The jackpot winner donated half to panda conservation.

examples.sentence: The Jacobean era saw Shakespeare create his greatest tragedies.
This Jacobean mansion still has its original oak paneling.
Her Jacobean leather boots matched the autumn leaves perfectly.
The designer chose a Jacobean hue for the vintage bookcase.
The Jacobeans were debating the union of England and Scotland.
This portrait gallery displays famous Jacobeans in ruff collars.
The Jacobites secretly drank whiskey to toast their exiled king.
Many Jacobite songs are still sung in Scottish pubs today.
The antique jacquard in the museum still has paper punch cards attached.
Modern jacquards can weave complex patterns with 10,000 threads.
Her cheongsam was made of silk jacquard with hidden dragon patterns.
This jacquard tablecloth is machine washable despite its intricate design.
The newlyweds toasted champagne in their hotel's heart-shaped Jacuzzi.
After hiking Mount Huangshan, soaking in a Jacuzzi felt like heaven.
Celebrities often post Jacuzzi bath selfies with cucumber slices on their eyes.
The Forbidden City displays jade artifacts from Ming Dynasty.
Her jade bracelet clinked like wind chimes.
Myanmar is famous for its imperial jade mines.
The pendant was carved from mutton-fat jade.
The old jade could still outrun young stallions.
He affectionately patted his jade's neck.
Her jade dress matched the lotus leaves.
The smartphone comes in jade color option.
The jade hairpin was a treasured heirloom.
Emperors used jade seals for official documents.
The marathon jaded even the fittest runners.
Her enthusiasm never jaded despite setbacks.
The new high-speed train is painted in jade green.
Yangzhou is renowned for its jade carving techniques.

examples.sentence: The jaded delivery rider fell asleep on his electric bike.
After pulling three all-nighters, her jaded eyes looked like expired tea bags.
The jaded millionaire yawned at his seventh luxury car.
A jaded food blogger complained: 'Another Michelin meal? How boring.'
Only Sichuan hotpot could excite his jaded palate.
The teacup has a jag where it hit the marble counter.
Grandpa's dentures left a jag on the apple when he bit it.
Be careful with the jag of that broken umbrella rib.
The jags on dinosaur fossils help paleontologists identify species.
That young jag just won the esports championship.
The old fisherman called the deckhand 'a brave jag'.
She jagged the cookie dough with fork tines.
The hailstones jagged every car hood in the parking lot.
The artisan jagged the leather edges for a tribal look.
Jag the paper strips to make DIY confetti.
The cactus spine jagged through my gardening glove.
His words jagged at her feelings like fish hooks.
Stop jagging at the elevator buttons!
The woodpecker kept jagging at the old pine tree.
The kids were on the jag after too many bubble teas.
The jagged mountain peaks look like dinosaur teeth against the sunset.
She tore the paper with jagged edges to make handmade Valentine's card.

examples.sentence: The jaguar's roar echoes through the Amazon rainforest like nature's subwoofer.
This luxury car brand borrowed the jaguar's sleekness for its logo design.
The melanistic black jaguar moves like liquid shadow in moonlight.
The thief spent three nights in a damp jail eating instant noodles.
Prisoners in this jail learn to raise ducks as rehabilitation.
Drunk drivers are held in the county jail overnight.
The protestors were released from jail after paying fines.
The corrupt official was jailed for embezzling disaster relief funds.
In some countries, you may get jailed for pirating TV series.
The influencer received a 6-month jail sentence for fake livestream sales.
No prisoner has successfully broken jail in this maximum-security prison.
The jailbird tattooed a teardrop under his eye during his sentence.
Old jailbirds often know all the loopholes in prison rules.
This jailbird has been in and out of prison like a revolving door.
Neighbors recognized the jailbird by his distinctive limp.
The gang leader was a notorious jailbird with snake tattoos.
Kids were scared of the jailbird who hung around the playground.
The jailed activist continued writing essays with smuggled pencils.
His jailed phone suddenly received a WeChat notification.
The hacker got jailed for stealing virtual mahjong tokens.

examples.sentence: The jailer checks each cell with a flashlight at midnight.
In ancient China, jailers often wore black uniforms with 'ç‹±' characters.
The kind jailer secretly passed steamed buns to political prisoners.
Modern jailers need psychological training to handle inmates.
The chief jailer holds the keys to all maximum-security cells.
The old jailhouse has been turned into a museum in Shanghai.
He wrote a novel about his jailhouse experiences during the Cultural Revolution.
The jailhouse lawyer helped other inmates with their appeals.
My grandma's strawberry jam tastes better than any store-bought ones.
The English tradition of having jam with scones is becoming popular in China too.
There was a traffic jam of shared bikes near the subway station.
The printer jam was caused by using wrinkled paper.
The company is in a financial jam after the failed product launch.
Forgot your wallet? Now you're really in a jam!

She jammed all her winter clothes into one suitcase.
The delivery guy jammed the package into the already full mailbox.
Tourists jammed the ancient town during the holiday.
Be careful not to jam your fingers in the elevator door.
The machine jammed the plastic bottles into compact cubes.
The printer keeps jamming when I try to print double-sided.
The drain jammed because of too much hair.
People were jamming into the subway during rush hour.
Fans jammed outside the concert venue hoping to get autographs.
The traffic jam on Beijing's 3rd Ring Road lasted three hours.
The jazz musicians had an amazing jam session until 3am.

examples.sentence: The Jamaican bobsled team became legendary at the Winter Olympics.
Jamaican Blue Mountain coffee is the champagne of beans.
Jamaican sprinters dominate the 100m world records.
The Jamaican patois sounds like musical English.
This reggae beat is Jamaican me crazy!
The Jamaican bobsleigh team inspired the movie Cool Runnings.
Jamaican Blue Mountain coffee costs more than my daily lunch.
Jamaican sprinters dominate the world's short-distance races.
My Jamaican neighbor teaches me how to make jerk chicken.
'Wah gwaan' is a greeting in Jamaican patois meaning 'what's going on'.

examples.sentence: The cat left scratch marks on the wooden jamb of our front door.
He leaned against the marble jamb while waiting for the elevator.
The antique clock was mounted between two stone jambs in the hallway.
Modern jambs often contain hidden wiring for smart home systems.
The delivery guy dented our door jamb with the refrigerator.

examples.sentence: The neighbors called the police when our karaoke turned into a midnight jamboree.
That birthday jamboree left confetti on the ceiling for months.
The tech jamboree in Hangzhou attracted 50,000 developers.
Our annual dumpling-making jamboree breaks Guinness records every year.
At the scout jamboree, kids learned to build shelters with instant noodles packages.
The international jamboree featured a TikTok dance challenge around campfires.
The 24th World Scout Jamboree was held in West Virginia with 45,000 participants.
The subway doors stayed jammed during rush hour.
My zipper got jammed with popcorn crumbs.
The printer is jammed with overdue homework.
Beijing's highways become jammed museums during holidays.
The live-streaming room was jammed with 100,000 viewers.
Hotpot restaurants get jammed like sardine cans on weekends.
We played Werewolf during a 3-hour traffic jam.
The Dali 3-month rental homes are jam-packed with digital nomads.
The military uses jammers to block enemy communications.
Some students built a WiFi jammer to prevent online exams monitoring, which is totally illegal.
The concert venue installed signal jammers to prevent drone filming.
News reported that jammers caused GPS failures in the entire district.
The concert was ruined by signal jamming from nearby construction.
Birds' radar jamming ability inspired stealth technology.
Military jamming made our GPS show we were in the South China Sea.
The hacker used WiFi jamming to create Internet paralysis.
The toddler's jammy fingers left strawberry prints on the iPad.
Her toast was suspiciously jammy after the breakfast meeting.
The couple next door keep jangling about whose turn it is to wash smelly socks.
Twitter threads often jangle into meaningless fights.
The delivery man jangled his keys like a heavy metal concert.
She angrily jangled the wind chimes to interrupt our meeting.
The jangle of mahjong tiles continued until 3 AM.
The kindergarten was full of happy jangles during snack time.
The jangle of construction work ruined my online class.
His alarm clock makes a jangle like falling saucepans.
The meeting was just political jangle without real decisions.
Ignore his jangle about cryptocurrency - he doesn't even own a wallet.
My aunt jangled on about her new yoga instructor for hours.

examples.sentence: The jangling keys in his pocket made him sound like a walking hardware store.
Jangling spoons in the cafeteria triggered my misophonia.
The jangling advertisements before movies are worse than spoilers.
Her jangling laughter cut through the library like a chainsaw.
The janitor at Hogwarts secretly protects magical artifacts.
Our apartment janitor carries 50 keys like a medieval jailer.
The museum janitor stopped a thief trying to steal dinosaur fossils.
Every school janitor knows students' secret snack-hiding spots.
The library janitor repaired torn pages with ninja-like precision.
As building janitor, he could fix anything from leaks to WiFi.
The chief janitor of the Forbidden City knows every brick's history.
The Japanese bow deeper when apologizing seriously.
Many Japanese carry handkerchiefs due to rare public paper towels.
Japanese uses three writing systems simultaneously.
The word 'emoji' comes from Japanese meaning 'picture character'.
Japanese convenience stores sell hot meals 24/7.
The Japanese bullet train once carried a Hello Kitty themed cabin.
Japanese grammar reverses subject-verb order compared to English.
This Japanese keyboard has hiragana printed on the keys.
This Japanese-English dictionary includes anime slang.
My tamagotchi still works after 20 years - typical made in Japan quality!
The comedian's jape about pandas eating bamboo made the audience roar.
His 'I'm Batman' jape became the office catchphrase.
The viral video of cats wearing hats is the latest internet jape.
Shakespeare's plays are full of clever japes.
The political cartoon was a biting jape at the minister.
His so-called apology was actually a cruel jape.
They kept japing about my new neon pink sneakers.
Don't jape about ghosts when camping at midnight!
The talk show host japed the celebrity's bizarre outfit.
Ancient jesters could jape the king without losing their heads.
He made a jape about AI taking over stand-up comedy.
The whole class japed at the teacher's new haircut.
She keeps her homemade chili sauce in mason jars.
The pickle jar slipped from his hands with a loud crash.
The jar of the earthquake woke the entire neighborhood.
There was a sudden jar when the subway brakes were applied.
The jar of nails falling on concrete made us cover our ears.
A metallic jar came from the malfunctioning printer.
The news of the celebrity divorce jarred the entire entertainment industry.
His blunt comments jarred against the polite atmosphere.
His modern design jarred with the traditional architecture.
The neon sign jars terribly with the historic district.
The rusty gate jarred whenever the wind blew.
Chalk jarred against the blackboard, making students shudder.
His cheerful tone jarred with the sad news he was delivering.
The bright colors jar with the solemn occasion.
The explosion jarred every window in the building.
The collision jarred my bones and left me dizzy.
The politician's remarks jarred the public's nerves.
The documentary jarred viewers into action.
His constant complaining jars on my nerves.
The pop music jarred with the classical art exhibition.
Blockchain jargon like 'hash rate' confuses beginners.
Medical jargon turns patient diagnoses into alphabet soup.
Streamers' jargon like 'poggers' spreads faster than memes.
Beijing taxi drivers have their own traffic-beating jargon.
His sleep jargon included ordering spicy hotpot.
The sleep-talking app recorded finance jargon in her dreams.
Fishing village jargon preserved ancient pronunciation.
Sichuan tea house jargon is disappearing.
Tech meetups sound like Star Trek with all the jargon.
Professor Wang always says 'cut the jargon' to PhD students.

examples.sentence: The jarring sound of subway brakes made passengers cover their ears.
Old bicycles often make jarring noises like popcorn popping.
Her jarring laughter cut through the quiet library like a knife.
The karaoke singer produced jarring high notes that scared cats away.
Wearing slippers to a wedding is visually jarring.
The modern glass building looks jarring among ancient hutongs.
The sudden jarring of dishes woke up the napping cat.
Construction workers are immune to the constant jarring of jackhammers.
Passengers felt a sharp jarring when the bullet train entered a tunnel.
The jarring from earthquake made vases dance on shelves.
The cultural jarring between generations often sparks family debates.
There was a jarring of opinions when vegans met barbecue lovers.
The director used jarring effects to create suspense.
The jarring transition from holiday to work gave me blues.
The scent of jasmine tea reminds me of my grandmother's courtyard.
She wore a jasmine garland at her graduation ceremony.
The walls were painted in a soft jasmine hue.
Her jasmine-colored qipao shimmered under the lanterns.
Newborn jaundice is as common as bubble tea in Taiwan.
The doctor checked her jaundice level with a transcutaneous meter.
His jaundice against spicy food vanished after trying Sichuan hotpot.
The film reveals society's jaundice toward left-handed people.
The hepatitis virus jaundiced his skin like a ripe mango.
Fake news jaundiced her view of the entire industry.
He views all startups with a jaundiced eye after his failure.
The doctor identified the jaundiced skin of the newborn.
Jaundiced eyes are a classic symptom of liver problems.
His jaundiced view of modern art comes from never visiting galleries.
The critic wrote a jaundiced review of the viral drama.
She threw a jaundiced look at her colleague's new Prada bag.
His jaundiced comments about the promotion were obvious to everyone.
Old professors often view TikTok trends with a jaundiced eye.

examples.sentence: Our weekend jaunt to the Great Wall ended with dumpling feast.
The CEO's morning jaunt around West Lake is his productivity secret.
They jaunted through tea plantations on shared bikes.
Pandas jaunt along the mountain paths after breakfast.
Let's go for a jaunt to that viral hotpot village!
